#### Viscido di Nocera, Langobard family from southern italy. Were not related to the Transalgardi.
#Landenolfo
#Alfano son of Landenolfo, attested 1042 and 1043, conte(of what?). married Porpra daughter of Leone Sergio.
#Pietro brother of Romualdo
#Romualdo son of Alfano,
#Aloara daughter of Romualdo
#Alfano II, son of Pietro
#Transelgardo son of Pietro

###################################
#da Canossa
###################################
#Signori e conti di Bianello, signori di Canossa e Gesso. Also Patricans of Reggio. Disputed whether directly related to Mathilda's family(Eithe via Corrardo and an unnamed wife or through a naturalised bastard of Mathilda's father. The alternative version is via marriage to Egina and Coalia who in turn isn't confirmed explicetly named being of the Canossa family either so can't see how that proves jack), but in either case they gained a lot of her propperties in Reggio. Im going with the Theoaldo-Orlando theory as timewise that one makes most sense imo.
1064350 = { #Orlando, natural son of Bonifacio. No date on the mention, but from context(which is a bit tricky since it jumps around a lot) it looks like later than 1030 but whether that means 1040 or somthing else is a tossup. There is also a refference for 1144 but that could just be a typo for Rolando I suppose.
	name="Orlando"
	dynasty_house = house_canossa
	religion="catholic"
	culture="italian"
	trait="bastard"
	father=7756
	1040.1.1 = {
		birth=yes
	}
	1115.1.1 = {
		death=yes
	}
}

#-424 reserved
###################################
#Palu aka da Palude
###################################
#Major landholders in Reggio, Mantua and Parma region. One of the most important vassal families to mathilda of Canossa. Conti della Palude, Reggio e signori di Crovara. Possibly related to  Gandolfingi(counts of Piacenza, but I have yet to identify what the possible link could be), the counts of Parma, maybe the Canossa and possibly also the later Rossi family.
### The possible link with the Canossa
#Attone I. Brother of a Sigifredo. Attested 918.
#Sigifredo I. Sigifredo di Lucca genisis of the Canossa.
#Sigifredo II, son of Sigifredo I.
##Parma branch
#Attone II, son of Attone I. Died before the 2. november 1062. Count of Parma. Seemed to have been married to Giulitta.
#Arduino(aka Ardecione), son of Attone II. Attested the 2nd of November 1062. Count of Parma.
#Giuditta, daughter of Arduino, married Alberto son of Rufo. 
#Gisla, daughter of Arduino ?
#Uberto son of Aruidno I, attested in 1096.
#Uberto II son of Uberto I, attested 1136.
#Gherardo, son of Attone II.
#### Della Palude propper

1061923 = {
	name="Guido" ##Guido di Gandolfo aka Guido di Palude founder of dynasty. Son of Gandolfo. Accused of nicking a pile of dough from the church of Reggio in 1032-1040. Conti di Reggio. Presumably given the title by Mathilda's father since it had been in the Canossa family beforehand and Bonifazio was known to favor the family. Dead before 10th April 1073. Married "Aldegarda" who were the mother of all his sons.

	religion="catholic"
	culture="cisalpine"

###########################################################
#Pierleoni
###########################################################
#Possibly a Jewish banker famly who converted and made it big time as Papal bankers(found a 17th century book mainly concerned with the Frangipane which contradicts the first generations of Pierleoni though, whether the senatorial theory used in the old book is a compassionate of "whitewash"(it was paid for by a noble family claiming to be related, and the jewish heritage probably wasn't popular) of their lineage to make it more glorious or the jewish theory isn't legit, I can't quite workout), consuls of rome, etc. Mainly of Guelp tendencies. Rivals of the Frangipane. Dominated Trastevere(had stronghold there), Isola Tiberina and the Marcellus theatere(had another stronghold there).
##
#17th century books early family tree:
#Giordano, senator of Rome attested 722.(Im guessing he is supposed to be of the Ancii family)
#Flauia, daughter of Giordano.
#Flauio(aka Flavio), son of Giordano.
#Diodoro, son of Flauio?
#Massimo, son of Flauio.
#Pietro Leoni antico, son of Massimo. Died 987.
#Pietro, son of Pietro Leoni antico.
#Giovanni Graziano, son of Pietro, cardinal, attested 1045
#Stefano, son of Pietro antico. attested 1030
#Unnamed daughter of leo(the one below)
#Rogiere, son of Leo.(the one below.)
#####
# Jewish theory, which seems to be dominant today.

Bishop of parma since 23rd of deceomber 1194, appointed Conte di Parma 1215(probably in 1214 when he met with the emperor's representative but he is first attested as such in 1215), attested as conte di Romagna the 20th of june 1220, exiled from Parma 1st of march 1221, he died the 22nd of May 1224 .

#Da Mare/De Mari
###########################
#Liguran noble family of frankish origin(claimed decend from count Adhemar who was a subject of charlie), several consuls and doges of Genova, marchesi di Assigliano, princes of Acquaviva del Fonti. Abranch settled on Corsica and became signori di San Colombano on capo di Corso, same branch gained the county of Corsica and became justicars of Cinarca.

#Turco
#################################################
#Patricians of Asti, staunch ghibelines(allied with the Isnardi and Guttuari). Signore di Tonco e Frinco. A branch also became signore de Lwuy in Flanders in 1337(claimed a debt). Seemingly unrelated to the Turco family of Ferrara, but related to the Veronese one. Their arms were a black eagle on silver with red crown.
#Gherardo, signore di Tonco 1084
#Riccardo, prior of the English hospitallars in 1189

#-74 reserved
#####
######################################################################################################
#Onesti/Duechi, Geremei e da Polenta
######################################################################################################
#Patricians of Ravenna, Cesena e Forli. Decended from the Friuli/Benevento branch of the Gausi. Related to the Sassi(the Sessi/Sesso of Reggio?), Alidosi(slightly hazy, but possily through an unnamed brother of St. Romualdo or the husband of his sister) and Cavalconti(the counts of Bertinoro, not the italian ones) families(possibly also the da Polenta and Geremei but its a bit hazy how with both of them). signori di Castel Leone(near Cervia). Duca degli onestsi( Re the duca title it was more specifically their family castle between forli an cesena from where they claimed the title at first(so basically duke of the family). Like with the Traversari "duca" was maninly origanlly used by the head of the family/faction leader, around the late 10th century it became a label for the current leader of the Scola de' Pescatori/Casa Matha(the guild of Ravenna's nobles, this didn't per se makes them actual dukes of ravenna in HRE terms though, power was shared with the archbishop(who was nominally in charge) and from the late 12th century both nobles and archbishop became feudal subjects of the counts of romagna). their arms was a red lion on silver who held a golden pinenut. sometimes depicted with just the lionhead and the pinenut dangling from its mouth.
#1063001- 1063099

#Onesta, mother of Pietro. Same as Onestina daughter of Onesto? No husband recorded by name, but I would put my money on him being of the Geremei dynasty given how closly allied the two families became during the next generations.

#dei Geremei, patricans of Bologna and to a leser extend Ravenna. Guelph tendencies and of frankish origin. Some relation to the Onesti, but seemingly mostly to the small Bolonga branch of the Onesti.
###############################
#Da Polenta, signore di Polenta, Comacchio, Cervia e Ravenna. their arms was red eagle on gold.

#1063140-1063159
################################
#Mainardi famiily.
################################
#mainhardi. Patrician family of Imola and Faenza. Signori di Fazenza from the mid 13th century. in 1st of may 1201 and 12th of june 1202 they along with the Buglari handed their possesions in Bertinoro to the archbishop of Ravenna. in 1218 it sounds like they had gotten control of the castle, since they wer dislodged from it by the Dusdei.
################################
#Bulagri famiily.
################################
#patricians of Imola and ravenna
#Pellegrino Bulgari, podesta of Imola 1159.
################################
#Brandolini
################################
#cisalpine patrician family claiming decend from a semi mythical counts. They also claimed the malvicini was a branch of theirs(very fuzzy), but it disputed(and has been since the 17th century). 
#Brando Brandolini, mythical conte di romagna in the 6th century. supposedly gained bagnacavallo.
#Sigismondo Brandolini, attesed in the 7th century. he is the supposed link between the Brandolini and the Malvicini, as the Brandaolini of venice claimed he was a direct ancestor of Arardo. 
#Tiberto Brandolini, attested 1039,
####trivia from the ravenna rool, not sure if related but the names looks familiar
#Rodolfo, father of Arialdo.
#Arardo/Arialdo, father of Coastamonte etc
#Costamone, guido and brothers. sons of Arialdo son of Rodolfo. returned som castles along the rubicone to the archbishop in  june 22 1136
################################
#Malvicini/Malabocca, d'imola
################################
#conti di Bagnacavallo, donigallia e cunio. They decended from the counts of Imola and Faenza(and there is the hazy theory with the Brandolini above). History is quite fragmented. Line is based Luigi Malpeli's family tree(which matches okay with Grazani), with the donigallia(Fantolini) added. Baludzzi's is less compatible.

#87-1063299 spares
################################
#Alidosi
################################
#signori di Imola, Castel del Rio e Tossignano. also patricians of Imola. guelph tendencies, their rivals were the Arrighi. Lots of longlasting conflicting theories of the their genisis, two prevailing theories being the Cunio branch of the Malavicni(seems like the most well founded but still not 100% firm) and the Degli Onesti.
#Fausto Alidosi. attested 906(prefect of Imola), 922(Capitano e senatore di Imola). Died 935. first person attested with the name.
####From 
#Lippo Aladuce. attested in Ravenna sometime 10th century.
#Romualdo Aladuce, brother of Lippo I. attested in Ravenna sometime 10th century.
#Aladugio, son of Lippo. Capitano di Ravenna.
#Masse I, son of Lippo.
#Masse II, son of Aladugio. Signore di Castel del Rio(first one recorded)
#Aladosio I son of Aladugio
#Nicolò I, son of Aladugio
#Maligarito, son of Masse II, signore di Castel del Rio
#Alidosio II, son of Masse II, Signore di Castel del Rio.
#Cesare, son of Masse II
#Alidosio III, son of Alidosio II
#Perello I, son of Alidosio II
#Roberto I, son of Alidosio II. 
#Liso I, son of Alidosio II
#Catarina, daughter of Alidosio II
#Lippo II, son of Alidosio III
#Roberto II, son of Alidosio III. 
####
#Roberto Alidosi attested 983, 986 and 1003, podesta and imperialvicar of Imola.
#Ugolino, Capitano di Imola 1010, attested again 1032.
#Ricciardo, brother of Ugolino. attested 997, 1010 and 1032. died in 1046. rebuild the church of San Lorenzo(was he an abbot?).
#Ranieri, brother of Ugolino and Ricciardo. attested 1046 died 1053(could look like he was apointed abbot or bishop of after Ricciardo)
#Teseo, Senatore of Imola in 1087. Led an attack on Bologna in 1067.
#Lodovico Alidosi attested 1086(led an attack against bologna), 1097.
#Alidosio de Malaparte, attested 9th of march 1159
#Roberto, son of Ugolino attested 1167.
#Camillo Alidosi atttested 1167(returned from France where he had been a mercenary) and 1187. died in 1207
#Maligarito, son of Camillo attested 1207
#Alidosio, son of Camillo attested 1207.
#Uguccione Alidsoi, attested 1228 as senatore in ravenna.
#Alidosio II, son of Alidosio. attested 1209
#Lippo/Lito I Alidosi, son of Alidosio, attested 1209 capitano del popolo of Imola 1278-1288.
#Alidosio Alidosi II(I), brother of Lippo I? prefect and senatore of Imola since 1289. 
#Lippo II, Alidosi, son of Alidosio. capitano del popolo of Imola signore di Imola 1334-1350. podesta of bologna 1334.
#Roberto, son of Lippo II. signore di Imola.

#conti di Siena, Fornoli, Pari e Civitella. Signori di Orgia, Sticciano e Torniella. Possibly an early cadet branch of the Aldobrandeschi, decending of Ridolfo di Roselle but its a bit murky(and lots of different theories). The Chighi was supposedly decending from them but haven't found a source that confirm a clear line.
1061300 = {
	name="Ranieri" #Ranieri, died before november 988. was married to Willa daughter of count Cadolo di Cadoloingi of Fucecchio.
	dynasty=1000035051  
	religion="catholic"
	culture="tuscan"
	920.1.1 = {
		birth=yes
	}	
	959.1.1 = {
		add_spouse=1061166
	}	
	988.1.1 = {
		death=yes
	}
}

#Pannocchieschi, possibly also decending from the Aldobrandechi like the Ardenghesci, but again very murky. I've put most emphasis on the appenendix in the "Dizionario geografico fisico storico della Toscana", lots of conflicting theories in differnt works.

	}

###
#Possibly additional line. Buuuuuuuuut seems most scholars assume that this line is in fact the Aldobrandeshi(hence the theories of them decending from the aldobrandeschi), as there is an extensive overlap with similar named contemporary members of the Aldobrandeschi.
#Ildebrando, dead before 19th april 1073
#Ildebrando, son of Ildebrando, attested 1084.
#Ranieri, son of Ildebrando I, attested 19th april 1073
#Uguccio Tezici, son of Ildebrando I, attested 19th april 1073
#Roberto, son of Uguccio attested january 1144. dead before the 2nd of june 1154. married Maria, daughter of Albertino.
#Enrico, son of Roberto, attested 2nd of june 1154.
#Roberto, son of Roberto, attested 2nd of june 1154.
#Ildebrando Pannocchia, son of Uguccio(or was his wife the daughter of? that would explain the confusion), died before the 17th of april 1151, married "Mathilda". held propperty in Volterra.
#Mathilda, daughter of Uguccio, attested 27th of may 1128. married "Azzo"
###

#1061394
#the lonesome Aldobrandeschi branch. This is the line that the Ardenghesca supposedly is related to.

###################################
# Bourbon del Monte Santa Maria
###################################
# Marchisi di toscana, conti di Arezzo e marchesi del Monte s. Maria. Like the Tarlati they are entangled with the marchesi del Colle. A subbranch later became known as marchesi del Colle(the one based in Petrella).
#Bobone, a speculative ancestor. The Bourbon part of the name is only attested since 13th century, but one theory which have been put forth is that the name must have come from an ancestor. No primary source support such a character though.

	culture="tuscan"

#-39 reserved
#############################
#di Chisusi
#############################
#conti di Chisusi, title used by a ton of subbranches(often at the same time). di Montedoglio, di Galbino, Cattani and Nardi-Dei descend from them. Barbolani/di Anghiari is related but its jolly complicated to find somthing completely coherent on how. Possibly also the Marsciano(or it could be a Sarteano-Marsciano link which is meant instead when it says chiusi).

	culture="italian"

	}

# Ubertini
###################################1065100 - 1065400
#patricians of Arezzo, dominated the Vallombrosa valley. signori di Valdarno, Valenzano, Banzena e Gaville, conti di chiusi(but then a lot used that title) e chittoor. Ghibelines. possibly a branch of the chiusi. supposedly related to the Donati of Firenze somehow but haven't found a good explaniation)

###############################################################
#Conti dei Marsi
###############additional notes on the counts of Marsi
#Conti dei Marsi. non related holders 843-926
#Ildeberto, appointed as conte dei Marsi in 843, died early 860.
#Gerardo, attested as conte dei marsi in 860. held it at least until 871.(was Ludwig II conqured it that year)
#Guido(Guido II di Spoleto, who also became king of Italy), appointed as conte dei marsi in 876. attested as conte dei marsi in 881 again. was raised to ducca di Spoleto in 883.
#Alberico II(7919), di spoleto. he was appointed visconte di Gualdeperto with jurisdiction of Marsi in 910
#Gottfredo Ottaviani(1062359), conti di Rieti, son of a Giuseppe di Palombara. became conte di marsi after Alberico(when?).
##########################################
#Bosonid
##########################################

#Di Marsciano

#The Marsciano counts claimed to decend from the Cadolingi. At least the "story of the counts of Marsciano" printed in 1662, and paid for by themselves links him to them(the writer of theri story was relying on a work from 1256 he found in the papal archive in Oriveto). A member of the house who died 1476 calimed the decend from the Chiusi counts instead though.

#degli Attalberti

#Attalbero, marchese di Toscana.
#Ranierio, son of Guido, attesested 1010.
#Teuzzone di Colle, cira 1050, son of Guido, father of Ardingo Barbolani.
#############################
#di Sarteano-Peponi-Maneti
#############################
#############################
#comital family from northern tiber valley and Siena area, conti di Sarteano, also held Radicofani for a time Chiusi. they were a branch of the beradegna. became patricians of siena and later Firenze. tended to lean guelph.
##

He beats her and when they visit the court of Sordello Visconti in 1224 she falls in love with him. After their return to Veronia she is aided by her brothers to runaway to Sordello in 1226). Rizzardo gets aid from Mantova but falls captive against Ezzelini in 1230. Mantova demands that Rizzardo is restored in 1231. In july 1231 the rector of the Lombard league rules that Rizzardo has to be released. When Ezzelini fails to comply Mantova invades, defeating Ezzelini on the 27th of july 1232 forcing the release of Rizzardo. A peace treaty is signed in August 28. but in 1233 the war is back on and the Rizzardo makes gains. 1239 Rizzardo refuse to change sides to the ghibelines against the league. In feburary 1240 Ezzelini leaves the league for the imperial cause. Died in Brescia during february 1254.

################################characters 1065800 - 1066199
#de'Conti(not related to the Lazio ones), with their clusterfuck of subbranches like Maltraversi etc
################################
####Conti di Padova, Vicenza, Montebello e Arzignano etc, later patricians in Padova and Viacenza
#Counts of Padova(relies heavily on Historia della famiglia Conti da Padova, di Vicenza, e delle discendenti da essa, con l'albero by Giovanni Andrea Salici from 1605 and should for early period in particular(but also for some of the later) be taken with a grain of salt. Storia del territorio vicentino by Girolamo Macc?have utilised when possible aswell)

#-98 reserved
###################################################3
###two characters who ruled Montebello but who are possibly not related(silly complicated juggleing these sources)
#Manfredo/Monfredo father of Ugone. Was a castle and count of Montebello without the name mentioned which were attested in 1022 and 1024.
#Ugone son of Manfredo di Montebello, became count in 1067
#####################################################
#Transalgardi, da Forzatè( aka Sforzare/Sforza-Tè), Capodilista(aka Capitibus Listae), Capinegri and Picacavra(shortlived branch that died out before thte 10th century)
#####################################################
#conti di Montemerlo, signori di Saccisica(sometimes they are confused with Sacco/Zacco, Saccisica is the same Pieve di Sacco), Torreglia e Mandria(supposedly since CM but castle not built before 904).
###first four is of semi mythical nature and should be taken with a grain of salt. Note that important characters called Carlotto Capodilista and Giovanni Forzaté both appear several centuries later so its quite possible that the actual divisions between the two branches actually happend in the 12th and 13th century.

	religion="catholic"
	culture="frankish"

		birth=yes
	}	
	780.1.1 = {
		death=yes
	}
}

1065976 = {
	name="Guecello" #Guecello, son of Gabriele I, led the army Belluno and Aquila against Ezzilino in 1164 but was captured. Released in september the year after. Married Gisla daughter of Ezzilino I. Was present at the peace negotians in Venice between the lombard leage, papal seat and the emeperor in 1177. Podesta of Treviso 1179-1181. Awarded Ceneda castle by the bishop in 1181. Fought for Aquila against Treviso 1190-1193(succesfully). Hostilities resumed 1198 and Guecello bore the brunt of the Treviso efforts. The 15th of June 1199 he submitted and became a citizen of Trevsio. Died before 1214(assumed 1203). 
	dynasty=prata
	religion="catholic"
	culture="venetian"
	trait=education_stewardship_1

	}

		death=yes
	}
}
1065987 = {
	name="Giovanni Francesco"#Giovanni Francesco son of Francesco, born ca 1380. Made Paodvan ambassdor to venice in 1405 where Padova reconigzed venice as liege. Later became venetian ambassador to the emperor. died 1456.
	dynasty=1000035232
	religion="catholic"
	culture="venetian"
	father=1065932
	1370.1.1 = {
		birth=yes
	}	
	1456.1.1 = {
		death=yes
	}
}

	culture = "venetian"

	}

#Zacco
################################
# signore di monselice, patricians di Padua(in oppositions to da Romano) later also in venice, podesta di vicenza. arms were cheeckerd blue and white.
#Zacco, founder of the dynasty attested 1080 in monselice.
#Mainerio di Monselice, attested 1137.
#Henrico di zacco. decapitated in 1234. alongside Bonifacio di Panigo by the Ezzelini. the two had served as captains in the bolongese army.
